info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF HARDIN COUNTY THROUGH 215 AM EDT... At 145 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Alger, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Kenton, Ada, Forest, Dunkirk, Alger, Blanchard, Mcguffey, Patterson, Dola, Grant, Jumbo, Huntersville, Pfeiffer, Walton, Hepburn, Mentzer, State Route 195 at State Route 235 and Silver Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
